= Response Formats =

Topsy provides resources in JSON format. A Javascript format is also available that wraps the response in a callback hook. This format is specified as a file-extension for the API request url.

|| *Name* || *Description* ||
||json||JSON string of the response object.||
||js||Javascript callback function call that takes the response object as a parameter.||

== JSON ==

When an API request uses a JSON response format, the response body will be in the form of a JSON object. An HTTP Header Content-Type: application/json` will also be sent.

== Javascript ==

When an API request uses a Javascript response format, the response body will be a javascript function call that takes one parameter containing the response object. An HTTP Header Content-Type: application/javascript` will also be sent.

You may specify the callback function via a query parameter in the API request. For example:
{{{
http://otter.topsy.com/trackbackcount.js?callback=foobar&url=http://blog.example.com/my-post
}}}

This API call will respond with the following body:
{{{
foobar({'request':{'response_type':'js','parameters':{'url':'http://blog.example.com/my-post'}, ... });
}}}
